website_summaries.verdict: Attractive and pleasant to use, with smooth button action and nice glide, this gaming mouse belies its rock-bottom price.
pros: Color-changing feature is an attractive bonus
Glides easily, and buttons click smoothly
cons: A little too lightweight for some
Color changing can’t be controlled or stopped
Side buttons’ forward-reverse function is opposite of what users are used to
Lasts about a year with regular use

customer_reviews.title: A level up mouse with a downgrade price!
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest mouse I’ve ever seen so far! You don’t have to be a gamer to appreciate this mouse. I love this mouse! I love how it glows in the dark with it’s different changing colors. I’m not a gamer but I bought this mouse because of it’s features, price and high rating. It does not need an additional software for it to function. It’s a plug and play. It is very comfortable to use. No complains so far. This is a level up mouse with a down grade price. My husband is going to love this mouse since he’s the one who plays online. 5 glowing stars for this mouse!
customer_reviews.author: Ivy Abey

customer_reviews.title: SUPER AMAZING MOUSE!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic price, fantastic for gaming, actually...this is the best gaming mouse I have ever owned. I can't believe I'm saying this. This little thing works better than my Logitech or Steelseries. It's SO responsive. It's large enough to fit my hand (I HATE those tiny little mice!). It's beautifully presented and packaged, and obviously well-made; hopefully made to last a long time. If not I will definitely buy another, and will probably keep several on hand as they are so well-made!
customer_reviews.author: C. Grice

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mouse for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I admit, I am a sucker for these "knockoff" electronics that look like ones that are far more expensive and have some of the same bells and whistles, just in a cheaper package. I find this mouse to be very comfortable - it is somewhat large, so take that into account if you are considering it. No problems with any of the buttons or the scroll wheel, and it looks very nice next to the keyboard I bought here that also has color changing LED lights. I like that the USB cord is braided as well - I think that tends to make the cord more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Janette C.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: fast shipping - great product! I was just about to give up on my word games on facebook til i got this mouse. fantastic gizmo and my wrist feels better than the last "ergonomic" one I had. The changing light were nice too though it would be nice to be able to lock onto one light - love the purple. Constantly changing color and fading light between is a little distracting but then I am easily distracted. Over all very pleased with style, comfort and function.
customer_reviews.author: doctormin

customer_reviews.title: Liked at first, too many issues.  Go somewhere else for your mouse needs
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these I bought, I loved at first. After about 8 months of use, the scroll wheel stopped working. Knowing that I do scroll a lot, I thought I'd try this brand one more time. The side buttons, particularly the "back" button are just way too close to the thumb, and now I'm either constantly accidentally hitting the Back button, or I'm so hesitant in holding the mouse, I'm getting anxiety worrying about it. Will be moving on to another brand, since there seems to be NO WAY HUMANLY POSSIBLE TO DISABLE THE BUTTONS IN WINDOWS 10.
customer_reviews.author: krehztim

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is usually great when it first arrives
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great when it first arrives. After about 1 year the scroll button stops working properly though. I have bought several from different manufacturers and they all have the same problem. Every other button still works fine, but the scroll does not work properly. For the price it's cost effective to replace each year or so though. I bought this same product again and it has a glitch. Keeps freezing. Tried different USB ports, restarting computer, different DPI. Nothing worked. Can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Katniss

customer_reviews.title: Works great, for about a year.
customer_reviews.text: Pros and Cons about this for sure, but it depends on your needs and setup. It has a very nice, thick, braided cord, but also has a rather larger than standard USB end that I dislike. I can't push my docking station as far back on my desk because of it. However, I bought it July 2017 and a little over a year later the wheel has stopped working. Which, once you get used to using is almost impossible to work without. The rest of it still works fine, but I definitely will be buying a new mouse, which is not something I would want to do on an annual basis if it could be avoided.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Mouse For Casual Gaming
customer_reviews.text: As a gaming mouse it has the look, but not the customization. Now, I'm a casual gamer and don't need anything too complicated. As for the look... love it. The lighting isn't programmable but is okay as it's a "breathing" effect. The hand feel and function is where this mouse shines! The mouse feels great in the hand and feels solid. The USB cord is braded and at 1.7 meters (5ft 5in) it is long but not too long. In summery; is it the greatest gaming mouse in the world... no. Is it the best value mouse that I've come across... without a doubt!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Haverly

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Mouse defective
customer_reviews.text: This is the most irritating mouse I’ve ever had. The scroll wheel is horrible it shoots way forward or way back no in between I played with sensitivity settings on the computer but it’s definitely a problem with the mouse. I use my wireless one and it doesn’t have the same problem. This mouse also likes to just turn off randomly and I will need to unplug and plug it back in. Again not a problem with other equipment just this mouse it’s awful or defective but I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: A.C.S.

customer_reviews.title: Ok for maybe the first year.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok for gaming, but if you just want it for a basic computer mouse because it looks pretty, you're better off investing in something else. I've had this mouse for just shy of two years, and for the last year of having it, the mouse is starting to act up. (Having to double, even triple click just to open files and such. Sometimes more.) I tried using different USB ports, and even a different computer entirely, but it came down to the mouse at the end of it.
customer_reviews.author: Count von Kit

customer_reviews.title: Used for gaming about 9 days, right mouse button is shot.
customer_reviews.text: After 9 days or so the right mouse started giving out, in the middle of an online match no less. I don't know if I had a defective unit, but the mouse was pretty nice well it lasted, the braided cable is always nice and multiple dpi setting are handy. I've had to go back to my old-faithfull mouse that I got from the hardware store, my brother had been using it for gaming about 2 years until this point and it's still going strong! Also returns weren't available for this item so I was a little bummed, I don't know if I have the box anymore anyway though.
customer_reviews.author: Gazaht

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Tracking is super smooth
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I love it. Tracking is super smooth, clicks are easy. The wheels has "notches", but it's smooth enough. The MMB click is good and positive, not too easy to click. The thumb buttons are placed fairly well, the rear one is easier for me to use with "claw" grip, the front is a little tougher to activate, but not bad. Honestly, this mouses thumb buttons are easier to use than my previous Logitech G602, although it had 6. My only complaints...it's very light, very very light. And the colors just cycle, no way to turn them off or set a specific color to stay on.
customer_reviews.author: phranticness

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Mouse for Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit hesitant to order this mouse; I liked the LEDs, but I was planning to use it at work, so it would get a lot of use for sure. I went ahead and did it, in May 2017. As of today (03/13/2019), it is working flawlessly. I use it for 40-50 hours per week, every week, and I have yet to encounter a single problem. Definitely a good decision to purchase this mouse; hard to imagine a better deal for under $10. Now I just need a matching LED keyboard. :)
customer_reviews.author: louieP

customer_reviews.title: Mouse doesn't work very well
customer_reviews.text: The mouse itself is not very ergonomic. It's really big and combined with all the weird angles on it makes for a very uncomfortable grip. The DPI settings are pretty pointless and the mouse wheel is already starting to make odd sounds. The back and forward button placement is not in a good place either, have to move my whole hand to be able to reach the forward button. I wouldn't buy this again and would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Fractal32

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, satisfying, good for gaming on a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all for gaming. The DPI settings aren't too crazy and the range is decent for amateur / beginner gamers on a budget. The controls are easy to use and the clicks are satisfying. The wire is pretty dang long, as well. The colors change constantly which can be annoying if you leave your computer on in sleep, cause the mouse might still be on. My only complaint is that I wish it was a little weightier. It's neither light nor heavy, but I like a bit of weight for some added precision. If you buy this, PLEASE read the box. It's hilarious. "Aggravating design," they say.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Had Potential...Had
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Looks great and goes well with my Havit keyboard with rainbow lights. Good weight and good DPI. Cons: It didn't last me more than four months. I had horrible freezing and stuttering after three months. Reinstalled Windows 10 twice, updated drivers and the motherboard. Nothing fixed it. I tried several different mice and they all worked fine. It's just this mouse that didn't work with my computer, unfortunately. You get what you pay for. I'm disappointed because I really like Havit and my keyboard is great and still working after a couple of years without any issue.
customer_reviews.author: Imaeya

customer_reviews.title: I really loved this mouse so much that I bought a 2nd ...
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this mouse so much that I bought a 2nd one for my office to use with my laptop, since I have a portable one which stays in my backpack for college. I wish I could say the 2nd purchase was as great as the 1st, since the 1st mouse is still working amazingly and we have not had even the slightest issue with it. The new one however, stopped working less than 2 hours into its 1st use. My computer beeped and said "unable to recognize" after it worked fine. Not sure if I should chalk it up to a factory error and just purchase another one or buy another mouse altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse and good customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse for my husband as a Christmas gift. And he loved it. We realized later it had a problem with the scrolling wheel but we didn't know it was the mouse we assumed it was a problem with a specific game or the new computer he had also gotten. It wasn't until after the 30 days you are given to return it that we recognized it was the mouse. I messaged the seller to see what could be done. They were so very nice and replaced the mouse! I was happy enough with the product alone to leave a 5 star review but even more impressed with the customer service. 5 stars very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla

customer_reviews.title: Had this for over a year...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this mouse well over a year I believe. It will probably get replaced with a 12 side button mmo mouse, but it has served me well and still works great! I’ve abused it quite a bit, and still not a scratch on it. I was worried about buying a cheap mouse, but this thing is pretty outstanding quality. The cable is cloth/rope coated instead of rubber/plastic which is really nice! The lights change colors and it is made of a good hard plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it!!! it looks amazing is my desk. Also it was here on time.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Scroll Wheel is Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this for about 2 months. The mouse is pretty uncomfortable in the hand for long periods. The sensor thats in it no matter what DPI you have it set on is not smooth at all. The scroll wheel was working for a while till recently (last month or so) stopped working correctly. When you scroll down or up it wants to do whatever it wants and jumps around. Cant really complain for a $8 mouse that has LEDS. I would spend the extra and get a logitec or razer.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work on all the systems it states
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 says ago and was hoping for a decent mouse because it had great reviews but contacted the company and there is no drivers for it and i cant get it to work on my computer a wireless mouse i got downloaded just fine and is working great so i hope they can figure something out for this cause 2 days is not long lasting when it wont even load lol well my loss your gain i would not buy personally and wont give higher stars till i at least get a response from the company and for the computer guys im running a windows 7 computer which it says it supports
customer_reviews.author: Julia C

customer_reviews.title: Natural feel upon first touch !
customer_reviews.text: I needed an alternative to my laptop's touch pad. I find the touch pad in no way ergonomic. Having studied computer workstation ergonomics in a course at Harvard and one at the OSHA Institute, I was hoping to find a graphical user interface that would allow me to work many hours in comfort. The HAVIT HV-MS672 arrived this morning and the natural feel was evident at the first touch. I wish this product was available 25 years ago when we were desperate to make computer workstations more ergonomic. The HAVIT product fits the hand perfectly, as if it is part of the body. The aesthetics are enjoyable thanks to the changing color lights and whimsical surface design.
customer_reviews.author: I_Love_America

customer_reviews.title: If you don't care about static illumination, for under $10 this is a really solid mouse.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I don't see how a mouse could get better. Note: This review is from the viewpoint of someone used to top quality $100 gaming mice and needed a secondary mouse for gaming while traveling. Pro: Responsive. Tracks movements beyond expectations. Has a very nice bright backlight. Right and left click make a satisfying noise that gamers love to hear. Cons: It won't stay static on 1 color. If the function is available, its unintuitive. It's by no means a mouse I'd pay over $30 for, but it is above its class for the price point. If you don't care about static illumination, for under $10 this is a really solid mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Bonsai

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent excellent excellent! It is as described by the seller and the cord is like threaded so it is very durable. The mouse worked perfectly up till now, after 2 years. The problem is that it randomly stops working, sometimes the computer will say "USB device not recognized". If I plug it in just right it works though. I don't have this problem with any other USB device. I wonder if it's just the age of the mouse or maybe the cord took some damage from carrying it around in my backpack a lot. Anyways I am now considering a wireless mouse and if this company has one I will definitely buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Jerome McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Cool mouse, especially those that prefer less light around them
customer_reviews.text: I disabled the fluorescent light above my desk at work because it hurts my eyes. To make my cubicle more inviting I bought a backlit keyboard. I then decided to get a light up mouse to go with it. I wish I had read the description better because the light cannot be made solid, it fades in and out through the colors. Still great but I like the feature on my keyboard to fade in and out or keep the light solid. This is my fault entirely so I still gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great lights, lasts a long while.
customer_reviews.text: I love the mouse shape it fits nicely in my hand, the shifting colors is very nice and sleep mode works(however I usually shut off my computer so it could just be that). I've used this mouse for 2-3 years now and I have never once thought about changing/upgrading. It takes a lot to break them, I broke one from significant overuse but I bought another so it's fine. Great shape, great colors and the DPI choices are nice. There is NO color customization but the rotations are still nice. Overall it is a nice mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Catie Rose

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item beause I got tired of all the wireless ones burning out the USB. I LOVE this! It changes colors, making it a nice visual experience. The cord is braided and covered. This is definitely worth more than the price charged. I've paid over $14 for a cordless mouse, only to have them break within 6 months. I don't even game, what this device is designed for, but it's still perfect for regular use. Buy this...you'll think it's fantastic too!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda C.

customer_reviews.title: Practically useless, very sticky scroll button
customer_reviews.text: Received this mouse to replace my old one (exactly the same model). I was buying a new one since my old scroll button was starting to go. I guess I shouldn't have been surprised that the scroll button on this one was malfunctioning the moment I plugged it into my computer. Almost feels like there's something stuck on it. Very sticky. This mouse was absolutely not even close to the eight dollars I paid for it. I guess I'll have to splurge for something that is at least basically functional right out of the box on the first day of use.
customer_reviews.author: Lillie

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse for Gaming and Even Just Casually Working on the Computer
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works great if you are playing games or just working on the computer. It is comfortable and has a cool light display that changes every couple of seconds. It can connect to the PC via a USB port and will usually connect automatically to the computer. However, there have been a couple of times where I have to disconnect the mouse and connect it back into the computer to get it to connect. But other than that, it is still in great condition. I have had this mouse for a couple of years now, and it still works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Teen loves it
customer_reviews.text: When my 17yo's first Havit mouse bit the dust after about 2 years, he wanted the same one again. This was a slight upgrade from the previous one, and he loves it even more because of the programmable buttons and high DPI. Though I don't understand much about all that, he says it rocks, so take it from him.
customer_reviews.author: PeaceWorks

customer_reviews.title: it's not terrible. But I've only had it for two weeks
customer_reviews.text: For its price, it's not terrible. But I've only had it for two weeks, and haven't been using it a ton and it's already giving me issues with its tracker. It doesn't detect when I move the mouse sometimes and then randomly moves it other times. Pretty irritating but it doesn't act up too much in the middle of my games so I'll deal until I can afford something better! (Or my old mouse, which is unavailable at this time, sad) It's also pretty big; I have small hands and it's worth noting! Looks nifty, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Mouse, a couple Flaws.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mouse if you are on a tight budget. I think the reason that I didn't like this mouse, is because I had played with an expensive mouse for the previous couple years to buying this one, and the slightly heavier weight and more programmable DPI setting may have spoiled me a little bit. I tried to play with this mouse, and I still have it as a backup in case something goes wrong, but it was just too light, and didn't have enough DPI setting for me personally.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Simple mouse, great colors!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse basically because I thought it looked cool and the price was low ($7.99 when I bought it). The colors are nice and the I have had no real issues with it. Overall, its a fairly basic mouse, right and left clicks, scroll wheel and scroll click, and EI forward and back buttons on the side. The mouse is NOT programmable to my knowledge. The mouse is very comfortable. If you are looking for looks and comfort, this is a great choice, if you are looking for function, I would spend a little bit more money and buy a mouse that is programmable.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Maria Creighton

customer_reviews.title: Good Mouse, Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great mouse, especially for the price but unfortunately I think that it's endurance leaves something to be desired. I play league of legends and other click heavy games so this may just be a case specific to a smaller number of people but the right click on the mouse only lasted about six months before it began failing. Customer Service for Havit however is awesome and they very quickly sent me a replacement. Would 100% recomend this mouse, 4/5 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing☼
customer_reviews.text: Not adjustable as notated. 7-Colors continue to change non-stop. Customer preferred: Red only. Manufacturer defect: Missing Adjustable Stationary Color option. Multiple rotating colors gets annoying really fast. DPI Button changes speed of cursor response only to slow, medium, and fast. Disappointing since it's a Perfect Ergonomic Sized Soft-to-the-Touch Gaming Mouse for small arthritic female hand. Back to the Quest for a perfectly small comfortable red LID light stationary optional Gaming Mouse... -_-' ♥
customer_reviews.author: ♥Curried Cutie♥

customer_reviews.title: Yes, buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Just a great mouse for the price. My son has had it for a year now, he plays for HOURS daily(including super clicky LoL), it travels with him multiple times a month, just thrown in a backpack, and it's still going strong. Warning: #1-It is a large mouse meant for man hands(I can't game with it with my tiny hands, I have to swap out mice when I play). #2-You cannot pick a static color but I think I assumed you could. Would absolutely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jellica

customer_reviews.title: Issue on USB 3.0, but not on the USB 2.0 Port.
customer_reviews.text: Have to use the mouse to change lighting Also when connected to the USB 3.0 ports the mouse will hang every so often and then move (Using Windows 10 Pro OS). Switch the mouse to the old USB port 2.0 and haven't had an issue with it hanging since. Checked for drivers... Only driver is the Microsoft one. Would have given a 5 star if they had software to manage it and if it would use the USB 3.0 port without hanging
customer_reviews.author: DAK

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My son really enjoyed this mouse. He uses it as a gaming mouse, and says it works great, so if any of you mothers out there have a son or daughter who are into gaming, this is a good (wired) mouse for them. I bought it for him as a gift and he loves it! Thank you! Thank you for reading my review. If you found it helpful in anyway, please let me know by clicking, as I try to track my reviews to make sure I'm being helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Sjogren's Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for its price, love the LED colors. A little big  for my daughter, but she will grow into it.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter says she really loves the mouse. For $9 and by Havit I think that is an amazing the DPI setting is a little much she says, but its works perfectly for her pc. As she was playing a game on her computer I noticed that the mouse was a little big for her, but she will grow into it. I would say for the price and the quality. And also the LED lights are amazing. You should definitely gets this mouse if you are a gamer, on budget.
customer_reviews.author: rita kalmus

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews and bought it. No just no. The lights are random and u can't control it. You can turn it off which is what I did. Instructions for it are lacking. The mouse is wide and the surface is very slippery. It's like glass so it's hard to get a grip on. Forward/backward buttons where loose on my mouse. I would look elsewhere unless you're a little boy or girl that needs a light up mouse to match their light up shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Christna Fredrick Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been used this mouse around one week. It's comfy to hold onto and textured along both sides to make it easier to grip. No connection and any anoter issues. if you don't use it for a while then it goes to sleep. Whenever you click or shake it, it will wake up and ready for you. It works exactly as advertised! It is a great deal for such good quality ! It looks cute too! Highly recommend to anyone who need it!!!
customer_reviews.author: liljoker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mouse for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse about 2 years now and man has this thing held up. The only problem I have is with it loosing connection from time to time which is mainly my fault for using it on my laptop and bumping the USB and bending the contacts a touch (maybe make that portion smaller as it sticks out about 2") but other than that its amazing. LEDs all still work, responsive clicks, good size for bigger hands, great DPI choices. Would recommend 100% anyone with a bad review either didn't read description or got a faulty one!!!
customer_reviews.author: tanner

customer_reviews.title: exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended this mouse because using a trackpad for fortnite was very difficult on my macbook air. I was apprehensive towards the purchase but the product came in the mail intact. I plugged it in and it lit up with no issues. Love how you can choose different lighting settings. Keep it on one color or have it set to go through them all. Seems to be working well so far. As of now I recommend this product. Will update the review if I have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Personal Acct

customer_reviews.title: There are MUCH better options for a similar price.
customer_reviews.text: I'd place this mouse low on my list of "budget" gaming mice. The aesthetic design is nice, and the 4 DPI settings are decent, but that is about it. The mouse is uncomfortable in your hands and the thumb buttons are very awkward to press. I was never able to use thumb button 1, and thumb button 2 still didn't feel natural to press. It also feels cheaply made, and has almost no weight to it. All in all, there are MUCH better discount gaming mice on the market for comparable prices. The G52 by FL-Esports is a perfect example of this.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Be carefull on purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Was delivered on time, looked great out of the box, plugged it in, again looks great all lit up, the LED mouse light, never came on. The mouse itself will not move, the led in the mouse doesn't work. Right out of the box, wont work, Tried to return it, but says I cant, guess I should have purchased insurance on it. Seller refers you back to Amazon return policy. Not helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: The little mouse that could
customer_reviews.text: I have put this mouse through hell. Dropped off the bed, batted off the desk by the cat, thrown at the monitor one time (don't do this) -- it's held up remarkably well considering the amount I paid for it. It works with both my main gaming PC and my Macbook, although I mostly use it with my PC and didn't try the side buttons with it. Considering it showed up in a box that said it was an "aggravating [sic] piece of design" I'm truly impressed with it. Replacing it soon so I thought I'd send it off with a nice review. For $9, it's not a bad piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: eli campbell

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a year. Havit download page non-existent.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this mouse for probably over a year. Used it with no complaints. For the last month, I've had random USB connects and disconnects where my PC would freeze up for a few seconds. Finally narrowed it down to just the mouse connecting and disconnecting. Went to the site to download drivers and it was pulled offline. Mouse is not usable after about a year, which is something I've never run into. For the price, I guess a year isn't bad but mice are cheap and I expect a good, long life out of one.
customer_reviews.author: MupAndJer

customer_reviews.title: The mouse itself works wonderfully in terms of function
customer_reviews.text: The mouse itself works wonderfully in terms of function. However I have no idea what alien lifeform they based the ergonomics on because human hands aren't shaped that way. Plus with the positioning of the buttons and the almost triangular shape, you cannot lift the mouse without hitting the thumb buttons; or you end up gripping it way up front where you either click the left/right buttons, or you let the whole back of the mouse fall/drag.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Flashy Junk
customer_reviews.text: Right mouse button barely works unless you press very firmly on the far front of the mouse (which makes it hard to reach, even for big-hands guys like myself). Mouse is amazingly cool to look at, but mouse that barely works is not useful at all. Also feels too light and cheap to really be a good gaming mouse. I would prefer a Razor or even Logitech over this.
customer_reviews.author: virtuadept

customer_reviews.title: ARRIVED BROKEN.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mouse a couple days ago and when I used it and it was broken. The Dpi button was stuck and Every time I would click on something it muted the master volume on my computer. I sent a message to the seller asking for a replacement or a refund and I got no answer. Such a shame because my brother ordered one and it worked perfectly fine and he liked his.
customer_reviews.author: Picadilly place

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise it starts off fine, when I first began using the mouse it ...
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the package you'll notice that what you've bought is of a much lower quality than you'd think it would be. Its packaging is laden with typos. Otherwise it starts off fine, when I first began using the mouse it functioned as it was supposed to, excelled even, but within a matter of a month, the scroll wheel began giving me issues. If you are scrolling down on the scroll wheel now, it will often scroll up instead, and vice versa. It happens randomly and it makes scrolling through webpages an absolute pain. It's a tempting price, and you'll be impressed when you start off with the product, but it has little to no durability.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne C

customer_reviews.title: I <3 my new mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. I wanted an ergonomic mouse because I've been having some elbow and wrist pain late, but only on my mouse hand. I recently bought a backlit keyboard with changable colors so I figured might as well get a lit up mouse as well. I figured for the price it would be just ... Ok. But I'm pleasantly surprised. It's VERY comfortable, I've fallen in love with the forward and back page buttons, and the colors.. Oh the pretty pretty colors. Seriously.. this mouse is great, and very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Broken Scroll Wheel
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent gaming mouse, hell I'd even go so far to say that it's the best gaming mouse under $10. That being said, I've only had the mouse a couple months, and now my scroll wheel is broken. Sometimes will scroll up but not down. Its really frustrating. In most games I can get away without using a scroll wheel but it's really upsetting trying to do literally anything on the internet. I just bought a second one with a protection plan, so when the new one breaks I have a backup, for less than $20 its still dope if you're gaming on a budget like I am.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The worst problem with computer mouses that I encounter: Scroll Wheel Broken
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine during the start of its use, but the scroll wheel suddenly stopped working only four months into it being my dedicated computer mouse. I liked the light-up function because I tend to work very late into the night and when I don't turn my lights on, the glowing lights provide some ambient light alongside my backlit keyboard. However, as my work and recreation on my laptop involves a lot of scrolling ( i.e through Facebook and Twitter feeds ), the most annoying thing I find in a computer mouse is poor scroll wheels. I would have rated this much higher if not for this fact.
customer_reviews.author: Moist

customer_reviews.title: Love the mouse, would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse; Graphic Designer and avid computer user here. My office is a bit bland so having the color changing mouse adds just the right touch to give it some flare :D the mouse is very comfy, a little large but great functionality. I am 5'5'' female and don't have the largest hands so I was a bit worried when I saw how big the mouse was but it actually worked out a lot better than I anticipated! and for $9.00.....what a steal!! Would absolutely purchase again and from this seller as well. P.S. if you want to see some of my work, check out fb.com/quickdams :)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but one major problem rends it useless
customer_reviews.text: It right-clicks, left-clicks and scrolls, but it will not track on the screen no matter what port gets used or device. I wanted to like it after reading reviews here, but if the mouse will not track movement, then it isn't a good purchase. I emailed the seller, so hopefully this can be resolved effectively. UPDATE: Got a response quickly from the seller for a replacement, so props to them for that. I'll post the final review once I get the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Baci

customer_reviews.title: Low quality - you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I got this mouse for the size. I didn't want a tiny mouse. I wanted something to fill my whole hand. I also wanted the built-in DPI. I got those things, but I'd only had it for about a month when the scroll wheel started to malfunction. Now, the scroll wheel is pretty much useless, which makes the entire thing pretty much useless. I guess $8 was worth it for 2 months worth of use, only one of which was at 100% functionality, but I'd have preferred that it lasted longer. Now I have to buy another mouse.
customer_reviews.author: MadameRue

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this on my gaming rig for the past 4 months, and I've not wanted to look at other mice yet. It's heavy, it feels durable, it is surprisingly ergonomic. Mine sits on a HyperX mouse pad I got from a CS:GO competition, they're HUGE, the mice glide on them like silk, and they're only around $20 for the best mouse pad you can ever want for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Unit562

customer_reviews.title: Another solid Havit product
customer_reviews.text: Havit makes nice products for about as cheap as you can get. This is the second mouse I've bought made by Havit. The mouse is mechanically sound, meaning all of the buttons work as they should. The mouse is responsive and the dpi settings all work perfectly. Obviously this isn't going to be quite as nice as some of the $60-100 stuff out there, but this mouse is enough for any gamer to be able to play effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: It has been well over a year, the led colors are still alive, the design is expected to fade with usage, which it did, the mouse wheel just died on my this week; great and simple for gaming; really good looking and feels amazing. Edit. 2 YEARS LATER! this badboy is still working like a gem, unfortunatly the paint started pealing, not as pleasing to look at as before, still, this was a good time gaming with it!
customer_reviews.author: Edgasful

customer_reviews.title: Affordable gaming mouse, but...
customer_reviews.text: I don't game often, I just needed a mouse for my laptop to make it easier to maneuver around all the different types of software I use that requires accuracy (adobe suite). It looks nice though, and the colors are really cool. You just plug it in and go. There is no software or anything that installs. My only gripe about it is the same as everyone else's - you can't keep it one color. Also that the design was a bit flawed (a few chips right below the words as shown in the photo attached), and the box looks like it was thrown around. Otherwise it's cheap and I guess you can't expect much for any 10$ mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mouse scroll is weird, and other cons.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse works well for everyday use, however the scroll does not work properly on my mac or PC. It's jumpy and twitchy. I've gotten used to gaming with the mouse, the cursor is smooth, but not always on point, would NOT recommend for a serious gamer. After months of use, the black coating has started to peel off where my fingers and hand rest most over time. Cons: Not very accurate for gaming, Scroll is strange, peels over use. Pros: Cheap, perfect for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Nika

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the older version.
customer_reviews.text: My son uses it for gaming. He had another that came with a keyboard that he loved and used hard for two years. Attempted to buy the same one. Looks the same but is a different model number. I'm buying the one WITH the keyboard. I hope it's as good as what he had from Havit.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren D

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it. I don't.
customer_reviews.text: Little cheapo mouse that you should NOT buy if you are a picky gamer. My 13 year old loves it but me... The DPI setting suck and there is no application for it for advanced mouse setting. I have HUGE hands and this thing is pretty big and not to comfortable to me. If you are an ADULT who knows about mice and gaming... DO NOT BUY THIS FOR YOURSELF!
customer_reviews.author: San

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a week or two
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and it worked perfect for about 2 weeks. Started randomly not working for tenth of a second or two during gaming and any gamer can understand the frustration with this. After Amazon sent me a new one for free this one got in a fight with a hammer. The hammer won. The 2nd one started doing to same thing and and the mouse buttons on top were acting weird as well. Gave 2 stars because I may have just been unlucky and got a bad batch. Worked great until it failed. Color changing option is cool but doesn't stay the same which fill find a way to annoy you.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The reason we bought is gamers equipment is better quality. We have gone through several mice
customer_reviews.text: We have used this for several days before this review. Needed a little time to get used to it. We are not gamers. The reason we bought is gamers equipment is better quality. We have gone through several mice. This is much better built. The biggest problem is when need to be precise. It is harder to use - I am getting better. Overall I would buy this again- hopefully not for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: merv58

customer_reviews.title: great mouse for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have seen some bad reviews for this device which made me skeptical to buy it at first but I am thoroughly satisfied with this mouse after using it for the past year. The mouse has never failed me so far and the change of color is nice. I wish they would add some more color schemes but for the price this mouse is hard to beat. I know this is a gaming mouse and I am not really a gamer I just wanted a RGB mouse for casual use...but for cause use this mouse is perfect and the clicks are just right!
customer_reviews.author: Vighnesh Ramesh

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is a great mouse, especially if you have larger hands like ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great mouse, especially if you have larger hands like me. It glides smoothly across a mouse pad, had adjustable DPI settings (via the little button right behind the scroll wheel), and had a pleasing array of vivid colors that it scrolls through. I have had several compliments from people, as the scrolling colors grans their attention. It would be nice (and should be fairly easy) to add the option to stick with one color or scroll through all colors, hence 4 of 5 stars, but the button positions, size of the mouse, plug-and-play ease of use, and adjustable DPI settings make this a great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Way cool and unique!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this for over a year and it still works great for gaming and the colors are always enjoyable, even all my friends who come over say they all want one. I like it when I’m producing music at night cause the colors gives off a relaxing vibe and when Not in use it won’t stay light up all night.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Risner

customer_reviews.title: Scroll Problems
customer_reviews.text: It is a great Mouse it works perfectly it was a little confusing when I first got it but thats what the instructions are for. My only complaint with this mouse is its scroll it is always getting stuck on the side and not working other than this, it is a great mouse and I recommend it for those of you who don't do gaming because it is annoying when you try to switch to a weapon and it gets stuck and you die but it is a great mouse besides.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Does

customer_reviews.title: The responsiveness of this mouse is rather surprisingly good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The responsiveness of this mouse is rather surprisingly good for the price. The only drawbacks are that the plastic over the buttons is rather thin so it may wear quickly, but time will tell, and the finish is a slightly textured plastic that feels very slick in my hand. Another thing to consider is that if you have gorilla hands like I do then this may not be the mouse for you. It's nice and large, but the grooves on the sides are fairly narrow for me so my thumb doesn't fit in it which makes for a rather awkward grip.
customer_reviews.author: CO Random

customer_reviews.title: The colors are backwards for how many DPI
customer_reviews.text: On mine the colors are backwards. At first I didn't know what "DPI" meant, but now I know. (for everyone like me: DPI= Dots Per Inch.) Anyway, the colors are backwards. Example: Pink/purple= 800 DPI and it's supposed to be 3200! I apologize if I sound picky, because it doesn't matter that much. It is a great mouse and I think you should get it. (If you're looking for a gaming keyboard as well, I suggest Rii RK100+ Multiple Color Rainbow LED Backlit Large Size USB Wired Mechanical Feeling Multimedia Gaming Keyboard.) P.S I was trying to do 4 1/2 stars, but it doesn't let you.
customer_reviews.author: starrynight

customer_reviews.title: My new fave mouse!!!
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this Havit mouse I didn't like it. It was a bit wider than what I was used to so it felt weird to hold it. It took a couple weeks but I have gotten used to it and now I prefer the wider mouse. My fingers and hand don't feel so cramped after being on the computer for a couple hours of hard core gnome punting in WoW. The mouse also changes colors. I'm a girl. I like that it changes colors. I like a pretty mouse!!! It comes with two extra buttons on the left side for keybinding. Love that option!
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these mice for my boys - can't beat the price. They both love the lighting/style of these mice and they both chose to use them over the spare Logitech G500 I have. They've both said that they'd prefer being able to select a steady lighting color instead of the color cycling, though. The only other quibbles I have are that there are no instructions with the mouse explaining what the small button under the wheel does (it seems to change both the light color and the mouse speed). A little slip of paper mentioning this would be more useful than the "I like it/I don't like it" card enclosed in the box.
customer_reviews.author: B. Daly

customer_reviews.title: Really good mouse for gaming or normal use. Looks very attractive and the lighting makes it even better.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is little bigger than the normal ones but very attractive and good mouse for gaming. Has led lighting to it with several setting give it extra attractiveness and is totally worth the money you spend. Highly recommended. ]
customer_reviews.author: Prasanna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic budget mouse
customer_reviews.text: This was my first LED glowing mouse and I've had 0 issues with it over 3 years of heavy use. I'm a big gamer and do use it for World of Warcraft, but it no means could it compete with a real gaming mouse. But $10 for a pretty, durable mouse? Heck yeah! I love the nylon cord, which increases the durability of the mouse. I love the cycling colors, but do wish I could choose which colors it used.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome budget mouse
customer_reviews.text: the side buttons are a little bit too mushy for my liking but this mouse is a super great budget mouse, for only $10 you can't ask for much. The LEDs are preset and cannot be changed. the colors cycle through in intervals of about 2-3 seconds which is perfect for me as it is not too distracting. The mouse itself is absolutely magnificent in the hands. the mouse is very comfortable to hold and the click buttons are very satisfying to press. would recommend this mouse for 1080p gaming and below. you should look for a better mouse if you are considering gaming on higher resolutions such as 1440p or even 4K
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: durable and high quality
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is a little lighter than most gaming mice I have used, but it works great for me. The shape fits my hand well, and the buttons work great. I wish you could control the color change more, but that isn't a big deal to me. I also use it for 3D modeling programs, such as Creo and SolidWorks. The buttons are easy to program and it is great for that kind of work. Additonally, I have had it for nearly a year now, and there are no issues with it yet. I think for the price, this is a wonderful product
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: great for what you pay
customer_reviews.text: I use it for a lot of gta 5 and world of warcraft. feels great and the side buttons are very responsive. only issue is the light configuration seems to reset after my PC is reset. I keep the rgb off since I leave my comp on while i'm sleeping, so kind of annoying having to keep turning it off. maybe there's a setting i'm missing, but I haven't found it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Nichlos

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse for cheap
customer_reviews.text: I use this product almost everyday and I have had it for a long time. I had one of these previously that I used for 2 years wonderfully. But after constant use it accidentally double clicks sometimes, which isn’t a big deal unless you’re gaming. The mouse has a bunch of cool colors and apparently it has a sleep mode(i’ve Never used the sleep mode). This is an amazing mouse for 10 dollars. It might take a tiny bit of time getting used to using the mouse comfortably but after that it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Good use so far
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using this mouse for my daily using, and even for my photo editing. Changing DPI is useful at times, I do appreciate this feature. Thumbs rests nicely on the side of the mouse, the width of the mouse is also nice. I like the woven covering on the cord, looks like it will last a while. Is use a Mac OS X (Lion to be specific), and I am able to 'program' the Mission Control, Applications Window, Show desktop, and Show dashboard hotkeys to two of hot keys on the mouse. I do not game so I have not tried programming buttons in that sense.
customer_reviews.author: ZEEBEE

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT product for the money. Replace annually with new mouse for best results.
customer_reviews.text: I'm telling you, for the money this is the way to go. I am a pretty hardcore gamer, and this mouse lasts about a year before needing replaced. But who cares? It is so cheap that replacing it once a year is no big deal. The design of the mouse is super comfortable and the buttons work great. What a great product. After one year of use, you will notice that your buttons will stop working the first time you click. That's when you know you need to replace the unit.
customer_reviews.author: LuckySl7vin

customer_reviews.title: BREAKS EASILY
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product while I had it, it fit my hand perfectly and was a good mouse. After about 3 weeks though there were mechanical problems in the scroll wheel and the left click, luckily amazon is amazing and took it back but I don’t reccomend this mouse, it just breaks too easily.
customer_reviews.author: Dolmanet

customer_reviews.title: good mouse for its price, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is nice and large, it fits okay in my massive hand and serves its purpose well. when I got it seemed to have this odd mode where instead of the mouse wheel controlling the scroll on a page it would control my computer's volume for whatever reasoning. I had to fiddle with the modes on it to remedy this and ever since its worked fine. I only wish you could change the setting on the lighting so that it's a static color but I guess for the price your paying beggars can't be choosers. 3/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: RICK

customer_reviews.title: Good Feel and very responsive
customer_reviews.text: Fits my hands nicely, my wife doesn't care for it because she has smaller hands. I'm not a large individual and don't have particularly long fingers, it's just not built well for smaller hands. Colors are nice and vibrant, looks very good with my setup. THE ONLY reason I'm not giving it a full 5 stars is because I cannot adjust the colors to the sweet ass purple I like so much. It just phases in and out in a set rotation. Very cool though and I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mandee Myers

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse for a nice price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my lil bro and the mouse feels ok for the price, My brother loves it. He plays fortnite with me using it, he likes the sensitivity levels on the mouse and the fact that i got it for a first mouse makes him pretty happy. He uses it on weird surfaces aswell as others and it responds pretty nice so I give it a 9/10
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Muñoz

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Product shipped relatively quickly. Unfortunately that's all it had going for it. Tested on multiple computers/laptop, checked for hardware in device manager. Mouse did not work. Checked website for drivers and found out mouse is Plug and play. Mouse was only able to light up/cycle colors. Contacted customer service which promptly issued a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Bought this mouse cause I liked how it looked but when it came it didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse cause I liked how it looked but when it came it didn't work properly it was freezing every few seconds for a few seconds at a time thought maybe was just the optical part but it wouldn't right/left or middle button click while frozen either happened constantly tried 2 other mouses and tried different usb ports and other 2 worked fine same thing happened when using different ports, faulty equipment happens usually not a big deal but the mouse didn't qualify for return either so now stuck with a defective mouse so that's why 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel

customer_reviews.title: Mesmerizing
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used a corded nouse in years. But I am tired of batteries dying while I'm gaming. I saw this mouse and decided to try it. I really like it. It took awhile to get used to the bigger size, but I love the cord. It isn't tbe typical solid hard cord that gets tangled on everything. It is more of a very flexible cloth cord. It moves well and hasn't gotten stuck on anything so far. The mouse also has the added bonus of slowly changing colors. Just slow enough to mesmerize you when you stop to stare at it.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Gift for the pickiest
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my son, who I like to call a rage gamer. He's very serious about his gaming and is known to rage quit and blame the technology (e.g. controller, mouse, lag, ...) for anything that goes wrong in his game. He enjoys the mouse and has yet to blame it for his game play. He really enjoys the 4 level dpi button (as does his younger brother who changes the settings while he's not looking). It's not a class A gaming mouse, but it's excellent for the price. I ordered another for my other gamer kid.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. One for my gaming desktop, and one for my work Laptop. I was like, let's see how good these are for $7.99. After a month or two of use. Wow, what a deal. I came from an abyss gaming mouse, and this is just as good if not better. I like the feel, how smooth it is, and the round cable protection. It feels durable. The buttons and the mouse have good response, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron McKannan

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I little lighter than expected, wish it had similar functions like the keyboard has to control on, off and pulse speed. The buttons on the side have a lot of free movement before the actually click and the right/left clickers seem a little thin flimsy at the ends. It's a cool mouse looking mouse and works fine though. The braided cable is sturdy as well. A great mouse if your not looking to spend a bunch of money on a gaming mouse
customer_reviews.author: Elvin

customer_reviews.title: 7 Months into the product and is NO GOOD! Beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse for my computer, light gaming, just overall because I like the look of it. After 7 months (not yet the year from purchase) the mouse is unusable. I do understand that you get what you pay for and I am cool with that. I wasn't expecting it to last many years. But what gets me the most is WHY does this company advertise "P.S WE HAVE 18-MONTH WARRANTY!" and proudly state it in their packing. I have been trying to get in touch with their warranty with no luck. HEY! Havit if you reading this, be a legit company and HONOR your warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Adriani M.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this mouse to game with and it truly works amazingly- something I definitely didn't expect, especially for the price. I've had it about 3 months now and I haven't had any issues at all with it. The extra buttons can be used to keybind in different games which is very helpful, and it looks really good too. I was definitely not expecting such good quality for such a low price.
customer_reviews.author: LibertyOH

customer_reviews.title: Durability issues
customer_reviews.text: I think the mouse is comfortable and looks/feels nice, but the right click stopped functioning properly within a few months of me getting it, and while I was sent a free replacement, the second one had its mouse wheel break within a few months of using it. Neither was ever dropped or anything nor were either subjected to rough usage, I suppose I could have simply been unlucky enough to receive two that were factory defected, but I find it suspicious that both mice I received had functioning issues like that so shortly after receiving them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: "This item isn't eligible for return."
customer_reviews.text: "This item isn't eligible for return." This is the message I got when I tried to return this item. DO NOT BUY THIS MOUSE. Total garbage. And you can not return it. The buttons are awful. The plastic slides on the bottom are no good and stick to the surface. The mouse movement is jumpy. This is a $2 mouse that they are overcharging for. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G.

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: I had a mouse similar to this before, but it felt very cheap compared to this one. The plastic is matte and very soft. it has a nice place to rest your thumb. as someone with bigger hands, sometimes mice and be too small and get uncomfortable, this one feels good to hold for long periods of time. although if you have smaller hands, you might have issues reaching the side buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Large mouse, I'm not a gamer I lust needed ...
customer_reviews.text: Large mouse, I'm not a gamer I lust needed a mouse for low light and the buttons are a bit touchy even after I adjusted to the lowest settings in windows 10. So If you're used to feat mouse this is for you. If looking for fast, adjustable, on the cheap. But as always I personally prefer Logitech stuff for my PC's. This one just happens to be in the garage with a lighted keyboard for you tube car, how to stuff,. Thus it is just what I needed., cheep.
customer_reviews.author: chris speidel

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and at first he didn't like it because it wasn't set up like his other gaming mouse was. He has adjusted to it and likes it a lot now. I would recommend it, the cord dose not tangle up as it's a cloth material. The one thing I don't like is when not in use it cycles threw different colors on the mouse itself. I have gotten used to that and can now sleep threw it. We have my husbands computer in our room so that's why it was annoying at first.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Ingram
